abstract: Jens Weidmann, 42, a trusted economics adviser, will be the youngest Bundesbank chief. His appointment will leave a big gap in Mrs. Merkel’s administration.
snippet: Jens Weidmann, 42, a trusted economics adviser, will be the youngest Bundesbank chief. His appointment will leave a big gap in Mrs. Merkel’s administration.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN  Chancellor Angela Merkel on Wednesday named a trusted economics adviser, Jens Weidmann, to be the next head of Bundesbank, the German central bank in Frankfurt, leaving a big gap in her administration as she tries to lead Europe out of its sovereign debt crisis.

headline.main: Merkel Names an Adviser to Lead the Central Bank
headline.print_headline: Merkel Names an Adviser To Lead the Central Bank
